I have such high hopes, Cheeky... (beat) Mr. James Murray has added immeasurably to the luster of our mission. And...with his participation, I genuinely believe we may have acquired the keys to immortality. ANGLE ON NINA as she ponders mentioning something. And th
(readies herself) I...do believe I am quite ready to accompany you on your next journey as well. Fawcett is surprised and flummoxed:
What...?

The children will be off to school by the time it would begin. And I’ve learned to read the stars and navigate, and become very well- versed in the history of the region. (beat) After all, it was I who found the document.
Lost City of Z White 7/31/15 62.
(dumbfounded; stuttering-- with a laugh) That would be--impossible. It’s not a place at all for a woman. She sits up:
Not a place? We believe firmly in the equality between us. So does he, now:

Equality, yes--of course. But in mind, not in body. The rigors of such a trip would be beyond your imagination. She turns away from him, turning onto the edge of the bed beat. Then, with her back to him:
I believe it is generally acknowledged that the pain a woman experiences in childbirth far exceeds anything a man must endure.
This is not about childbirth--
What do you know of childbirth? Have you witnessed a minute of it, much less endured it? He gets up, out of the bed, walks to face her. Kneeling:

Cheeky--the jungle is years of hard work and experience in the art of soldiering. It’s about maggots in your skin, and deadly snakes, and disease. I love you and I could not bear that. (beat) The children need their mother. She gets up, off the bed, walks to her dresser. He STANDS does not approach her (instead, staying close to the bed)
Lost City of Z White 7/31/15 63.
Somehow I was able to bear the dangers you faced, the years you were gone. This way, we might be together--
You're my wife. I need you here, not as a tentmate in need of constant care. Be reasonable. She turns to him, flush with anger:
You will throw “reasonable” in my face?
I'm simply speaking the truth-- She approaches him, strong and evincing a centeredness:

Was it reasonable to stay here and struggle to provide for the children while you wandered the jungle? Now you’ve no relationship with them whatsoever. And you have given no thought to my aspirations. He turns away from her, his hand slicing the air as he ma his points:

Men and women have each performed their roles since the beginnings of time. This is a cornerstone of our civilization. A man does not take his wife into the most dangerous place in the world on a whim!
I did expect more understanding from you and I am disgraced by your ignorant posture! Young JACK enters. He stares at the quarreling couple. He GRABS ONTO HIS MOTHER'S LEG with a FEROCIOUSNESS:
I’m all right, darling. Your father and I were just having a discussion.  57 Lost City of Z White 7/31/15 64. Jack will not let go of his mother as he STARES at HIS
(to Jack) It’s late, Jack. Return to your bed. I will come tuck you in ina moment. Jack won't budge.
Mother, I love you.
The child finally lets go and leaves the room. She turns back to Percy. A LONG BEAT. Then she moves to him, takes his hand.
I’ve not prepared myself for the jungle, it is true... They come together. Softly, emotional:
(emotional; sotto) I couldn't bear that you might think my dreams ridiculous...

text: SUPERIMPOSE: “MATO GROSSO REGION, BRAZIL. 1912”. The party hacks away. Fawcett, Costin, Manley, two Indian men, and James Murray, bringing up the rear. Two MULES, t HORSES, three DOGS. Fawcett leads and is ferocious, hacki as if he were swatting bees, with a giant machete in one and a map in the other. (Fawcett is looking slightly native.)
(calling out) One hundred twenty-one miles until Oviedo’s last marking! (to Costin) (MORE )
+e HF
Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 65. Costin has stopped, is examining himself.

Damn these things... Fawcett then looks down at Costin’s arm. He’s got MAGGOTS eating his flesh. And an INECTION which has begun in his nostrils--ESPUNDIA. FAWCETT PAUSES. HENRY COSTIN (CONT’D) My nose now, too. Don’t YOU ever get so much as a bee sting?

(still to Costin; jokes) Mr. Costin, do you not know I have not my equal for virtue in the service? The insects honor this! Fawcett is immediately on the move again, slides down a m path toward the RIVER. Way behind him: Murray is struggli The weight of the backpack. PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) Where’s Mr. Murray?
Bringing up the rear, Chief. Calls out:
Mr. Murray!
Yes, Major Fawcett!
How are you managing?
(huffing and puffing) Very well, Major! Acquiring many samples! But--but my pack’s getting quite heavy! Perhaps...I ought to leave some of my accoutrements behind!
You don’t want to be ill-equipped for the journey ahead! You’1ll need all you can carry! +e * HF
Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 65A.
Of course! I’m speaking merely of my extra clothes! They’re slowing me down a touch, that’s all! (MORE )
58 Lost City of Z Goldenrod Revision Set 10/18/15 66.
I’m sure to be moving better if I might lose them! Fawcett looks back at Murray, who is lagging way behind:
Very well--when we get to the river. But you MUST keep one change of clothes and your mattress!
Bugger probably wishes he were back on the South Pole... Fawcett stops. Turns around:
(almost peeved at Costin) Mr. Costin, he’s proven his valor beyond doubt when you and I were wet behind the ears. (beat) He’1l pull his weight soon enough.
And what weight. (sotto) He’1l wind up bringing us down with him, I tell you... Fawcett continues to chop away. The group reaches the riverbank.
The Group is in canoes. Quiet, except for Manley:
We've gotten ahead of the others...
A magnificent view, Mr. Fawcett.
(MORE)
59 Lost City of Z Goldenrod Revision Set 10/18/15 67.
You'll see greater sights than this, I promise you...
The thought thrills me, Major! I assure you, it thrills me! Murray then puts his handkerchief in the water.
I don’t advise that. We don’t know what’s in that water yet. Murray nods, stops what he is doing. Beat. ALL OF A SUDDEN: ARROWS! Arrows and spears rain down on t men.

Savages! Arm yourselves! MURRAY takes out his RIFLE. In fact, ALL the men--save Fawcett--take out their RIFLES and FIRE INTO THE AIR. Fawcett sees the Indians through the trees. Costin looks and down:

We’re surrounded! FAWCETT SPINS HIS HEAD AROUND. They seem DOOMED. The GUNS ARE FIRING, IN THE AIR. The ARROWS COME, FAST AND FURIOUS ANGLE ON FAWCETT as he seems to think of something... Fawcett yells to his comrades:
Hold your fire! HOLD YOUR FIRE! The canoes halt on the bank and the men get out, moving through the water to the:
MURRAY moves near the riverbank, hiding from the arrows u tree branches.
Look for cover, men! Fawcett instructs Arthur Manley to:  60 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 68.
Mr. Manley! Play your accordion!
My accordion--?!?
“Soldiers of the Queen,” come on!
All due respect sir, they seem likely to skin us alive!
Mr. Manley! Do as I say! (to everyone) Everyone--“Soldiers of the Queen”! A “YES, SIR,” could be heard. Manley begins to play, and whole party begins to sing:
In the fight for England's glory, lads, of its worldwide glory let us sing! Fawcett then unties the handkerchief around his neck and waves it above his head at the Indians. No effect.

Fawcett enters the water again. Waving his handkerchief. The river gets deeper. He stops somewhere near the middle with the river around his armpits. THE ARROWS AND SPEARS NOT STOP COMING. He wades directly INTO the fusillade of arrows. He repeat over and over, in Portuguese and other dialects:

Friend! Friend! Friend! The arrows keep coming, FASTER THAN EVER. Several come INCREDIBLY CLOSE, zooming right by his head. We can even hear a ZIPPING SOUND. But Fawcett braves it nonetheless, holding a SURVEYING BOOK in front of his face to protect from the arrows. THWACK! An ARROW HITS the SURVEYING BOOK in front of his face! Fawcett stands there, a man between two sides of the rive between two worlds maybe, and closes his eyes.  Aél1 B6él 61 62 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 69. The water surrounds Fawcett’s armpits; no one moves.

EXT. CEYLON BEACH Aél1 A FLASH of shots, over which we STILL HEAR the sounds fro the jungle: 1. A SHOT OF THE BUDDHA - a statue, surrounded by dark vi a COLORED RIBBON is TIED to it, BLOWING IN THE WIND 2. A SHOT OF NINA and PERCY - on the BEACH. Holding hands 3. A SHOT OF A BUDDHIST PRIEST - standing in front of the
I will take the Pansil... I vow not to kill or injure any living thing...nor to take that which is not given...
EXT. RIVER B6él Then: THE ARROWS AND SPEARS STOP. Fawcett opens his eyes. The sound returns--except that it’s gone quiet. A GUARAYO INDIAN peers out from the forest.

Paddling out toward Fawcett in a raft, the GUARAYO takes handkerchief from Fawcett; Fawcett motions to be taken across, and the two go to the Indian side with Fawcett kneeling humbly on the flimsy float. The whole group waits in silence for Fawcett, who disappe into the forest.

(to the others, loud) All of you! Should the red man attack, keep your eye on me! Rally to me at all costs! EXT. RIVERBANK —- MOMENTS LATER 62 MOMENTS LATER: the Indian emerges, CHEERFULLY wearing Fawcett’s Stetson hat. PANIC! IS FAWCETT DEAD?!? THEN: +e HH OH
63 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 69A. Fawcett emerges too, smiling. He waves to his men.
(to himself) Good God. The group, including Murray, all venture across the river
The men slowly approach the area. Human skulls abound. A HUMAN BEING’S BODY is BEING COOKED on a SPIT. The troops spooked. Murray, in particular, seems appalled.
I recognize a bit of the chief's language. It’s safe for us.
Are you mad?!? They’re cannibals!
I recognize your reluctance and I sympathize. (MORE )
64 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 70.
But I’m asking you to trust my experience--we must attempt to engage.
(incredulous) They've cooked a body, for chrissakes! Have you gone insane?
It’s a dead member of the tribe-- his spirit will enter them if they eat it. It’s their custom. (to the whole group) They may have critical information about our destination.

(to the others) They’1l kill us, these savages! (to himself) I refuse this madness. I refuse it! Manley, Costin, and the others look at Fawcett as though is insane as well. MURRAY STARTS TO BACK AWAY, toward the FOREST. JAMES MURRAY (CONT’D) Madness! Fawcett sees the others agree with Murray to a degree. He doesn’t respond, and a brief look of madness, of possessi flashes across his face. So instead he walks to:
The other men eventually, reluctantly follow Fawcett into tent--though conspicuously missing is MURRAY. Packed with both our guys and the Guarayos now. A beat of silence, th to Costin:
Can you give them something?
Yes--yes, of course. Costin stupidly strikes _a_match, and though panicked, th Indians calm quickly when Fawcett takes out a glittering necklace:  Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 70A.

No--it’s a gift! A gift! For you. And your--your son?  Lost City of Z White 7/31/15 71. The Chief Guarayo, sitting next to a boy, gestures to him PERCY FAWCETT (SUBTITLE) (CONT’D) Yes, wonderful... I have sons, too. The Chief smiles, points to Costin, Manley. Fawcett laugh PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) (CONT’D) No no, my sons are far away.
How can you be so far from them?
(his smile disappears) Our world is not like yours... ANOTHER GUARAYO, A WOMAN, responds:

All people are made of the same clay. The Chief takes a crushed BERRY COMPOUND and gestures to FAWCETT around his EYES. FAWCETT COMPLIES, spreading the DARK RED MIXTURE ON HIS FACE. Then one of the GUARAYOS reaches for Costin’s ARM. At fir Costin has trepidation, then allows the man to grab his forearm. THE GUARAYO WHISTLES LOUDLY, in a STRANGE PITCH. And the MAGGOTS in Costin’s arm STAND UP. The Guarayo simply squeezes gently and the maggots fall on the ground. Costi arm_is cured of the maggots--! Costin TRIES TO WHISTLE like the GUARAYO but cannot:
Not sure we have the touch. (back to the Guarayo;

We're looking for old houses, many houses, many many people, deep into the forest. Do you know of this? The Guarayo speaks in his native tongue. Then, to Costin: PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) He’s heard rumors, but is uncertain. Further down the river, he believes there’1l be others who can help us.  65 66 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 72. Then another Guarayo motions to his mouth. Food. PERCY FAWCETT (SUBTITLE) (CONT’D) Food--yes--thank you! ANGLE ON THE CHIEF as we GO TO:

A Guarayo crushes a plant with a stone and lets the juice spill into the water. A milky cloud forms. After a moment DOZENS OF FISH RISE TO THE SURFACE, gasping. A Guarayo bo wades into the water and pulls out the biggest. Fawcett, had been making his own face up with beads, bows his head thanks as he takes the fish. Fawcett turns and looks at the water.

MY GOD! It’s only stunned them! They don’t kill any more than they have to! ‘S remarkable! The other fish that the boy didn’t withdraw from the wate swim away. EXT. GUARAYOS TENT —- CLEARING 66 A thunderstorm is coming. Fawcett, with his makeup lookin native now, walks into the clearing, and in front of him sees that here are THOUSANDS of Indians living about. An astonishing discovery. And they are not just savages. The have advanced methods of farming; MAIZE GROWS AS FAR AS T EYE CAN SEE. Costin approaches:
We seem to have lost Mr. Murray.
They've made the jungle into farmland somehow. All the families are working together--and there is no rank or superiority among them. It’s truly humbling.
Chief--
Designed at right angles, mathematical in its precision. (MORE )
67 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 73.
It confirms so much of what we believed. (to Costin) Can you imagine what our lost city must be like...?
Chief, did you hear me about Mr. Murray? Your great polar explorer’s gone lost in the trees--

Mr. Murray is an accomplished man-- we're not to fret over him. And anyhow, he can’t have gone very far. Tell the men I’ve designed new rafts--the canoes are riddled with arrows and useless now. We’1ll be off on foot in the morning... Fawcett walks into the field of MAIZE. The wind blows the plants, and Fawcett is an incongruous figure amidst the Guarayos, who tend to the crops. Costin watches as Fawcett approaches the LEADER OF THE GUARAYOS and teaches him to HANDSHAKE. A GOODBYE OF SORTS
You may stay here with us. Join your spirit to ours.
(a beat; awe) You honor me beyond words. But it is not yet time for me to rest.

Murray is asleep on the ground. He has gotten lost. Strew nearby: his machete, all the photos of his family. Sittin in the mud. Food eaten, the wrappings all over. Turkish cigarette butts... He awakens to see FAWCETT AND THE REST OF THE GROUP, approaching him. Fawcett sees all the food’s been eaten. Murray, Fawcett must appear a strange figure--with his FA PAINT, now slightly streaked from the rain like tears...
Thank God you’ve found me--I--I got lost. (MORE )
Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 74.
I didn’t think we’d survive in the presence of those horrible savages. My clothes and mouth--full of grit!

You'll be looked after. We must be on our way now-- BUT THEN: Fawcett reaches down, finds: AN EMPTY BOX OF CARAMELS. INSIDE THE LID: “For your journey, darling, I l you. Nina”. A FAWCETT FAMILY PHOTO IS INCLUDED. Something changes in Fawcett. DARKENS. PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) This...was from my wife and children... (beat) For all of us.

Yes--I know--I was hungry! It was supposed to be just a short rest. The scrub’s incredibly dense and I fell. I think I’ve a terrible fever... A BEAT. And then Fawcett looks like he is about to EXPLOD His EYES BULGE WITH RAGE:
Get up. Fawcett turns, ferociously hacks a branch with a machete.
Mr. Fawcett--just one more moment of rest... I’m very tired-- Fawcett FREEZES. SPINS BACK AROUND. Raging:

You're tired? You have no right to be tired! (beat) My own sons--at their tender ages-- could be counted on more than you. I could be with them at this very moment, yet I am here with YOU, to attempt great things.
He collects himself, bends down again. Privately:  68 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 75. PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) You stole from the group and violated our trust. I won't have this again.

(shocked) How dare you speak to me that way! Have you seen my leg? HAVE YOU?!? Fawcett looks down: Murray’s leg has a gash. Fawcett bend down, looks at the wound. The other men surround Murray. Murray's things have scattered all over the jungle.

It’s not yet infected, but if blood * poisoning should set in, you'll be a dead man. (beat) If you’d stayed with the group and trusted the so-called savage, you’d be fed--and cured. As it is, we’ve got to hope for the best.
(at a loss for words) Yes, well, I’1l, I’11l do that! ANGLE ON MURRAY as FAWCETT walks away. He is STEAMING.
They are rafting. Dizzying. Murray is SHIVERING, VERY SIC a mess. Maggots have overwhelmed his legs. Fawcett and
Costin are maneuvering the raft. * BUMP! The rafts shift with the river’s flow. Murray and * Costin fall off the raft. Costin knows what to do; he sta swimming to shore. Murray does not. *

Swim to shore! The water’s too * rough for piranhas! * Instead, Murray attempts to hold onto the raft and threat to capsize it. PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) I said, swim to shore! The raft starts to shift. Fawcett is enraged:  Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 75A. PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) God damn it! (beat) (MORE )
69 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 76. PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) Let go! You pink-eyed weakling--
The raft tips, and TWO CRATES OF SUPPLIES GO TUMBLING * OVERBOARD. Manley tries to stop them, to no avail... *
Fawcett directs the raft to the shore using a bamboo pole The raft bumps up against the riverbank. Everyone has congregated. All are out of breath. Fawcett eyes Murray with utter contempt.
We've just lost a third of our * rations! *
(glaring at Murray) * Getting to the city and back was already going to be difficult.
For heaven's sake, I was drowning! Didn't you SEE?!?
There was no chance of that! And this after you took our food!
I suppose the honorable course of action would be for me to starve, then? Is that it? Is that what you wish for? My death?!? Fawcett, to Costin:
Where are we now, do we know? Are we behind our schedule?
Yes. We are-- *

You're entirely without mercy! You could at least slow down to give a lame man a chance for his life! Still not paying attention to Murray, Fawcett remains fix on Costin. Seeing a couple of ABANDONED HUTS behind Costi  Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 76A.
Pitch camp here for the night, we'll determine our progress.  70 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 77.
And now you ignore me!
One of the HORSES starts to collapse. Looks very ill. A CREWMEMBER turns to the others, shouting:
Horse down! The Crewmember takes out his gun, SHOOTS THE HORSE.

Murray has a fever. Truly sick: swollen, distended, in terrible shape--covered with maggots. A colorful snake ha from a tree over his head. He moans over and over, shivering. To a noncomprehending Indian, he gets deliriou
I’m going to die too, just like that horse. I’m a man of property...now worth as much as that horse... SEEING THE MAGGOTS, TEARS COME TO MURRAY’S EYES. COMPLETE

JAMES MURRAY (CONT’D) The affrontery of this upstart, and his vulgar quest for glory... Like a Judas...delivering me over to this jungle when he handed over our Lord, to be crucified... Father, forgive me this trespasses, As we forgive them that trespass against us... But...but let me not compare myself to thee, my Lord. You have delivered me from other evils, Lord. The fierce cold in Antarctica, was I weak then? (strained smile through tears) He is not even worthy to kiss the hem of my garment, Lord. Even as I am not worthy to touch yours... Give me strength to survive, to forgive this man his sins against me...
Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 78. Costin comes over to Fawcett, who is standing near the fi Pondering...something. Manley is here, too.
We're about two weeks behind our planned pace. That’s my best guess, from the sextant and the * charts. * In the background, James Murray lets out a MOAN.
It appears our Mr. Murray’s got blood poisoning now.
Yes... I’d noticed that. (beat) So much for his good bloodline.
I caught him with our maize yesterday morning. He claimed it was from his own private store. + eH Fawcett moves closer. Sotto voce, looking at Murray:
I fooled myself for some time, but no longer--the man is a cancer. If * we keep him with us we won’t survive, much less reach the city and return to our families.
I say we ditch him, leave him to rot. I’ve wanted to from the beginning. His Lordship’s a coward and a thief. *
I’m in agreement, Major--there aren’t two sets of rules, one for the high and one for the low.
What’s it going to be, Chief? * Fawcett eyes Murray.  Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 78A.
PERCY APPROACHES MURRAY, around whom flies swarm. Murray eyes Fawcett suspiciously:
What is it...?  Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 79. Fawcett speaks deliberately, almost as if proving a case courtroom. In measured and careful tones, like a speech h has prepared:

When traveling in the jungle without other resources, every man must realize that if he falls sick and cannot move with the others that there must be consequences. The others cannot wait and die with him. (beat) Do you understand? Murray seems to get it. An awkward beat, then: Murray sta to grip his revolver.
You’re only here--all of you-- because of the funds I provided! Costin whips his shotgun out, points it directly at Murra Pushes the shotgun up against his cheek. A tense moment.
Many of us have families back home. And I cannot allow you to further jeopardize the welfare of our entire party. (to Costin) Mr. Costin. As Costin takes Murray’s revolver from him:
You don’t care one whit about me or the rest of our party, Mr. Fawcett. You don’t even care about returning home--you only care about finding your bloody city!

There are some in our group that would have me abandon you here and leave you to die. But I will not. There are mining encampments south of us, along the river. In the morning you'll be on your way to them. I’11 give you our last horse with what supplies we can spare and an Indian to guide you.  71 72 Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 80.

You'll pack me off with a bloody swamp wog, will you? (beat ) This calm willingness to abandon me is a queer thing to hear from an Englishman. But it does not surprise me, as I have now sufficiently gauged your class and character.
Murray is placed atop a mule. Manley and Costin have trai their guns on him. Fawcett notices MURRAY’S INFECTED KNEE
Godspeed, Mr. Murray--
(interrupting, with rage) Let’s hope our paths don’t ever cross again, Mr. Fawcett. For your sake. With that, Murray rides off. Fawcett and the others watch the mule disappears into the jungle.
Good riddance, I say.
Any chance for him, Chief?
Slim, to be sure. But it’s the best we could do... (beat) Let us go.

Fawcett leads the men as they slide down a steep canyon. RAIN comes. LIGHTNING. THE RUMBLE OF THUNDER. Fawcett looks up, through heavy downpour: SEES what he th is a MASSIVE STONE FACE CARVED INTO THE WALL OF THE CANYO A _GODLIKE VISION.
Lost City of Z Green Revision Set 09/30/2015 81. Then, A ROAR. The “STONE FACE” CARVED INTO THE WALL OF TH CANYON seems to CRUMBLE AMIDST THE DOWNPOUR... Fawcett SEEMS in a TRANCE when--
Chief!
Yes, I saw it! We’re close now! The men are SOAKED. FROZEN. PANTING. FAWCETT, HOWEVER, IS

All our reserves are lost! The CAMERA TILTS DOWN. Costin and the others have flung o the rations CRATES. INSIDE, the rations are COVERED with OIL. Ruined: HENRY COSTIN (CONT’D) They're covered in paraffin! The bloody bastard destroyed them! (beat) We've got to head back!
We can’t! We’ve nothing to show for our efforts--no evidence--

MAJOR! With what little we’ve got on our backs, death would be certain within days! If we’d still had the horse you gave Murray and all it could carry, we might have a fighting chance! Fawcett ponders. Through gritted teeth and deep rage:

God damn me for a fool to bring him!  73 Lost City of Z Blue Revision Set 8/19/15 82. Then: he bashes the side of a rock repeatedly with his machete. Pure frustration over the whole situation. Over this, we HEAR:
To be sent to the R.G.S.: Mr. James Murray was forced to separate from our expedition to seek medical attention. His location is currently unknown, and he has most likely perished.
Fawcett has arrived in La Paz, Bolivia, to the British Embassy. He is writing on a notepad a message to the RGS, which an English Officer is typing:

The British Minister has his case in hand and his family should not be contacted unless there is definitive news of some kind. The rest of the group shall arrive back in England as soon as is possible... Fawcett looks at the counter. CLOSE SHOT ON a newspaper. The headline, in Spanish, is all about the ASSASSINATION THE ARCHDUKE FERDINAND and WAR IN EUROPE. The ENGLISH OFFICER sees Percy looking at the paper. In a jolly tone:
(grinning) Looks like a war with Fritz! We'd better all get home or we’ll miss our chance to fight!
(eyes him; then, re telegram) Please send this immediately.
Yes, sir. WE SEE PERCY WALK OUT OF THE OUTLET into the distance...  75 Lost City of Z White 7/31/15 83.

It’s quiet, punctuated only by the sounds of boys playing the distance: Fawcett’s sons play with a rugby ball. * CLOSE SHOT on a BEAUTIFUL BABY GIRL, ALMOST A TODDLER, sitting on the ground surrounded by blocks. We HEAR:
That is Joan, as you might have guessed. Widen to SEE FAWCETT and NINA in the backyard of the hous eyeing their daughter. Nina has a BROAD SMILE.
Beautiful name. For a beautiful child. (to the toddler) Joan, I’m your father. * SHE SMILES AT HIM, POKES HIS FACE. An instant connection.
I’ll go and get the boys--they’re * playing a fierce match--
No no. Let them finish. It’s good * for them... *
(beat) * There are many urgent telegrams waiting for you, inside. Fawcett nods.
Perhaps it’s about the war, on the continent--

(interrupting her) It’s not. It’s about my mission. I’1l need to go to London soon, no doubt. There will be a reckoning. * He steps forward, watches his boys play in the distance. PERCY FAWCETT (CONT’D) I came close, Cheeky. I had to turn back, for the good of the men. (fighting tears) (MORE )
